REMARKS: This Stunning Colonial Farmhouse is an important piece of Bedford & American history as home of Captain John Moore, Commander of the Bedford Militia.  Built in 1680, it was painstakingly restored in a 2004 renovation by renowned builder James Lichoulas for his family.  This sun filled home offers all the modern amenities yet keeps the Antique Colonial charm of the period.  Exposed beams and original wide plank pine flooring are balanced by high ceilings, a Gourmet Granite eat-in-kitchen, Master Suite with his & hers walk-in closets, and a 3rd floor Media Room.  A potting room with original Copper shelves and antique Soapstone sink offers a hint of the amazing grounds.  Three car garage with potential 2nd floor studio, generous balcony with amazing views of the landscaped gardens, and a picturesque Barn finish the property.  Nicely situated between Concord Center and Bedford Center.  Walking distance to the bike path, Chip-in Farm and Elm Brook Conservation Area.
